sentences.english: Accumulates the certificate and various aspects certificate has a big pile.
sentences.chinese: 累積下來的獎狀和各方面的證書就有一大堆。

sentences.english: Certificates of Second and Third Class Honour will be sent to school by mail after the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 二等及三等獎獎狀將於頒獎禮後郵寄至學校。

sentences.english: Dr. Peter Lee receives the award from Mrs. Selina Tsang.
sentences.chinese: 李仲賢博士接受特首夫人頒授獎狀。

sentences.english: A certificate of merit will also be awarded to each winning participant.
sentences.chinese: 各得獎者將獲頒發獎狀一張。

sentences.english: The teacher presented the student a awarding paper.
sentences.chinese: 老師給那位學生髮了一張獎狀。

sentences.english: Winning teams will be awarded with a certificate.
sentences.chinese: 勝利隊伍將由外語部頒發獎狀每人一張。

sentences.english: One of the mayor's jobs is the presentation of prizes.
sentences.chinese: 頒發獎狀是市長的工作之一。

sentences.english: A certificate of merit and a medal will also be awarded to each winning participant.
sentences.chinese: 各得獎者將獲頒發獎狀一張及獎牌一面。

sentences.english: The awards for the NWCS Chinese Writing Contest will be distributed this week.
sentences.chinese: 本週將頒發本學期作文比賽之獎狀及獎座。

sentences.english: Children who guessed right won a sticker prize.
sentences.chinese: 猜測正確的孩子將贏得一個獎狀。

sentences.english: Mr. Li also participated in the distribution of awards & player certificates.
sentences.chinese: 最後，李主任還爲表現優異的選手頒發了證書和獎狀。

sentences.english: In the prize presentation ceremony, certificates were also presented to volunteers for their support to the City-lympics campaign.
sentences.chinese: 此外，同場亦頒發紀念獎狀與活動義工，以示鼓勵。

sentences.english: Vice Mayor Deng Qunfang delivered the awards to the recipients.
sentences.chinese: 副市長鄧羣芳爲獲獎者頒發了獎狀。

sentences.english: Do you have any awards or commendations?
sentences.chinese: 你有得過什麼獎勵或者獎狀麼？

sentences.english: Attains the certificate time we very are all happy.
sentences.chinese: 拿到獎狀的時候我們都很開心。

sentences.english: "Miss Blythe gave Alf the prize for "Best All-Rounder.
sentences.chinese: 她把“全優”的獎狀頒發給了阿爾法。

definition: special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer
